abstracts.cdata!:
The Agricultural Sector Investment and
            Institutional Development Project Loan for Costa Rica
            approved in March 1992. Negotiations were held October 7 to
            11, 1991, temporarily suspended due to a disagreement over
            the timing of agricultural trade and price reforms, and
            completed on November 22, 1991. After several extensions of
            the Loan effectiveness deadline, the Loan was allowed to
            terminate, without having become effective, on April 11,
            1994. The primary reason the Loan was terminated was
            government's failure to comply with effectiveness
            conditions related to the same agricultural trade and policy
            issues that caused the temporary suspension of negotiations
            in late 1991.
